basedOn.display: MR CERVICAL SPINE WITHOUT AND WITH IV CONTRAST

valueString:
EXAM: MR CERVICAL SPINE WITHOUT AND WITH IV CONTRAST


COMPARISON: Brachial plexus MR 4/23/2024, 3/8/2022 and 6/27/2021


FINDINGS: 
Numerous T2 hyperintense, enhancing masses along the left greater than right bilateral cervical nerve roots and throughout the paraspinal soft tissues, compatible with history of schwannomatosis. Many of the lesions demonstrate cystic degeneration. The 
largest extraforaminal schwannoma at C4-C5 on the left (series 7, image 23) measures 3 x 3.4 cm and has mildly increased in size since 6/27/2021 where it measured 2.7 x 3.1 cm. The remaining schwannomas have not significantly changed in size.


Grade 1 retrolisthesis C6 on C7. Vertebral body and disc space heights are maintained. Mild spondylotic changes of the cervical spine. Mild uncovertebral and facet arthropathy results in moderate neural foraminal narrowing at C3-C4 on the right. No 
significant spinal canal or neural foraminal narrowing at the other levels. No abnormal cervical spinal cord signal or enhancement.
